details.title: COVID-19 HIGHLIGHTS | 47,253 cases: Karnataka overtakes Gujarat as fourth worst coronavirus-hit state
details.content: For the first time, Karnataka witnessed a record hike in COVID-19 with over 3,000 people testing positive in the last 24 hours. With this, the state tally reached 47,253, making it the state with fourth highest caseload in the country. (READ THE HIGHLIGHTS HERE)

details.title: Plasma Therapy starts in India
details.content:
#BigBreaking: Convalescent #PlasmaTherapy begins in #Odisha. After 4 recovered persons including a doctor donate plasma of different blood groups at SCB MCH, Cuttack, one unit of B +ve plasma transfused to a 48-year-old #COVID19 patient at Ashwini Covid Hospital. @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/cTh9ycq84Q

— Hemant Kumar Rout #StayHomeStaySafe (@TheHemantRout) July 16, 2020

details.title: Patna HC restricts entry to visitors as cases spike in Bihar capital
details.content:
Entry to the Court complex shall be restricted to very few authorised persons and other persons including staff are not required to come to the office from 16th July to 23rd July in view of the lockdown in Bihar from 16th July: Patna High Court. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/3a96h6Zzit

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: Close to 3.3 lakh samples tested in last 24 hours
details.content: 1,27,39,490 samples tested for COVID-19 till 15th July, of these 3,26,826 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research.

details.title: Lockdown scenes from Karnataka
details.content:
Karnataka: Lockdown being observed in the Dakshina Kannada district. A week-long lockdown has been imposed in the district starting from today till July 23 with relaxation hours between 8 am to 11 am. Visuals from Mangaluru. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/Iuo6KrwTKR

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: 32,695 COVID-19 cases and 606 deaths in last 24 hours
details.content: Highest single day spike of 32,695 COVID-19 cases and 606 deaths reported in the last 24 hours in India. Total positive cases stand at 9,68,876 including 3,31,146 active cases, 6,12,815 cured/discharged/migrated and 24,915 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

details.title: Lockdown starts in Bihar
details.content:
Bihar: Movement of vehicles continue near Chandani Chowk in Muzaffarpur dist amid the lockdown imposed in the state from 16th to 31st July.

All transport suspended in state except taxis-autos, pvt vehicles for permitted activities,essential service providers& transport of goods pic.twitter.com/wcRbdQWlFC

details.title: 29 new positive cases in Mizoram
details.content: 29 new COVID-19 positive cases confirmed in the state in last 24 hours, taking the total positive cases' tally to 267 including 159 cured/discharged: Department of Information and Public Relations, Government of Mizoram.

details.title: Congress MP cultivates paddy in Chhattisgarh amid lockdown
details.content:
Chhattisgarh:Congress MP Phulo Devi Netam was seen cultivating paddy at her village in Kondagaon.She says,"I come from family of farmers. It gives me solace to work here.Many people are saying there's labour shortage due to #COVID.There's no shame in doing our own work." (15.07) pic.twitter.com/zbJPACeAMq

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: Classical dance classes in Odisha goes online
details.content:
Odisha:Classical dance&music learners are attending online classes to continue their practice.Sangeeta Gosain,CEO,Odissi research centre,Bhubaneswar says,"Many webinars are being done.Some are very good&useful.However,some are below standard,but you can't control." (15.07) #COVID pic.twitter.com/VkyMud271B

— ANI (@ANI) July 15, 2020

details.title: News from Kerala
details.content:
Kerala: A #COVID19 treatment centre with over 1000 beds has been set up at Calicut University in Malappuram. K Gopalakrishnan, District Collector, Malappuram says, "Patients who have tested positive but don't have any symptom will be treated here." (15.07.2020) pic.twitter.com/VWV2DGNwci

details.title: Latest Assam tally
details.content: 1,088 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Assam on July 15 including 649 cases in Guwahati. Total cases stand at 19,754 including 12,888 recovered, 6,815 active cases and 48 deaths: State Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: 136 new positive cases in Indore
details.content: 136 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on July 15, taking the total number of positive cases in the district to 5,632. Death toll in the district stands at 280: Chief Medical and Health Officer, Indore district.

details.title: Lockdown norms flouted in Delhi
details.content: 31 people holding a social gathering at a restaurant in Paschim Vihar were detained by police yesterday for indulging in drinking alcohol, in contravention of the conditions of lockdown. Case registered, further investigation on.

details.title: Recovery rate nears 64% in India
details.content: The recovery rate among COVID-19 patients has increased to 63.24%. The recoveries/deaths ratio is 96.09% : 3.91% now: Government of India.

details.title: News from Tamil Nadu
details.content: 40 Indian fishermen,stranded in Iran due to COVID lockdown, returned to Tamil Nadu yesterday. These fisherman from Kanyakumari,Nagapattinam,Thuthukudi, Ramanathapuram,Nagapattinam,Cudallore,Thirunelveli were handed over to respective district officials. They will be quarantined for 14 days.

details.title: India's situation bter than any other country: Union Health Minister
details.content: Despite being such a largely populated nation, we can perhaps claim to have performed better than any other country. Today our fatality rate is 2.57% and recovery rate is 63.25%: Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan.

details.title: Update from Kolkata Airport
details.content: A passenger who had arrived in Kolkata from Delhi via Guwahati on a SpiceJet flight on 14th July was found to be carrying his test report showing him to be COVID-19 positive. During thermal screening, his temperature had come out normal: Kolkata Airport Director.

details.title: Lockdown scenes from Patna
details.content:
Bihar: Shops closed & streets deserted as lockdown is being observed in Patna today. The state government has imposed a lockdown in the state from today till 31st July due to rise in #COVID19 cases. pic.twitter.com/id80AaEJmT

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: UGC on status on University exams across country amid COVID-19
details.content:
• Universities were approached to inform the status of the conduct of examination. Response received from 640 universities.
  • Out of these, 454 have either conducted the examination or are planning to conduct.
  • 177 universities are yet to decide on the conduct of examination. I
  • n case of 27 private universities, which were established during 2019-20 to till date, the first batch is yet to become eligible for final examination.

details.title: First indigenous COVID-19 vaccine candidate developed by Zydus to enter human trials
details.content: he Department of Biotechnology under the Union Ministry of Science and Technology has announced that ZyCoV-D, the plasmid DNA vaccine candidate designed and developed by Zydus, has entered Phase I/II clinical trials. This makes it the first indigenously developed vaccine candidate for COVID-19 to be administered to humans in India.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Former UP minister and Samajwadi party leader Ghoora Ram dies of COVID-19
details.content: Former minister and Samajwadi party leader Ghoora Ram died of coronavirus early Thursday morning at the King George's Medical University in Lucknow, his family said. According to the SP leader's son Santosh Kumar, he was admitted to the hospital on Tuesday after he complained of a cough and difficulty in breathing.

details.title: Meghalaya to close all entry points to state from July 24-31
details.content: The Meghalaya government has decided to close all entry points to the state from July 24 to 31 to intensify COVID-19 surveillance, as its caseload rose to 354 on Thursday with 16 more security personnel testing positive for the infection, officials said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Active Covid-19 cases manageable, says Centre as India reports record 32,695 cases in 24 hours
details.content: Out of the total cases, 6,12,814 have been cured so far, while 3,31,146 are currently active. In the past 24 hours, 20,783 patients were declared cured, taking India's recovery rate to 63.25 per cent. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Test Kilpauk mental health institute inmates for COVID-19 within a week: Madras High Court
details.content: The Madras High Court on Thursday directed the state government to test all 800 inmates in the Institute of Mental Health, Kilpauk including the staff within one week.  The Court Issued detailed directions in providing exclusive care and treatment to each of the inmates if they test positive, (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Punjab caps COVID-19 treatment rates for private hospitals
details.content: For moderate sickness requiring isolation beds, including supportive care and oxygen, the rates per day are fixed at Rs 10,000 for all private medical colleges or NABH (National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare Providers) private hospitals with teaching programme, the government said in a statement. details.title: Varavara Rao tests positive for COVID-19, lawyer urges he be shifted to private hospital

details.title: Unlike IPL, some domestic cricket tournaments likely to face axe amid COVID-19 outbreak
details.content:
While much attention will be on the IPL, it is learnt that a decision on the tournament will be taken only next week, after the International Cricket Council’s Board meeting on Monday. The FTP will see a few changes. There are chances that the five-Test series against England in February-March will be reduced to three, in order to accommodate more limited-over fixtures.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 'Avoid touching surfaces': COVID-19 warning brings the world to a halt for these blind people
details.content:
42-year-old P Raja who is living alone in Egmore is experiencing just that. Since his wife and daughter left for Madurai just before the lockdown, he has been staying alone. "Volunteers come and drop the materials and leave. I have not even spoken to anyone properly since my phone too is under repair." he said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Gujarat crosses 45,000-mark with 919 new cases
details.content:
• With 919 new coronavirus cases, Gujarat's tally breached the 45,000-mark on Thursday, while 10 more patients succumbed to the infection, said the state health department
  • After the addition of 919 new cases in the last 24 hours - the second highest single-day spike so far, the tally went up to 45,567
  • As many as 10 persons with COVID-19 infection died across the state, taking the toll to 2,091, it said

(Inputs from PTI)

details.title: COVID-19 hands makers of Mysuru's clay Ganeshas a bleak Chaturthi
details.content:
There are over 20 families engaged in keeping alive the legacy of making traditional Ganesha idols using clay in Mysuru. Usually, during festival time, they get a handful of orders and come together to make idols and earn their livelihoods. But this year, thanks to COVID-19, the demand for big idols has dried up.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Delhi records 1,652 fresh cases; new cases above 1,000 for sixth consecutive day
details.content:
The national capital added 1,652 new coronavirus patients to its tally on Thursday, authorities said as the daily case load remained in the range of 1,000-2,000 for the sixth consecutive day. With the number of active cases declining steadily, the recovery rate stood at over 82 per cent.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: IN PIC | The Metro hustle of Delhiites has been on halt for over four months
details.content: Metro trains stand parked at a yard after services were closed for commuters in the wake of coronavirus pandemic in New Delhi. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: Court dismisses plea seeking FIR against Ramdev for claiming to have found 'cure' for COVID-19
details.content:
A Delhi Court Thursday dismissed a plea seeking lodging of an FIR against yoga guru Baba Ramdev and others for allegedly cheating people by falsely claiming that his firm Patanjali has found a cure for COVID-19, noting one case has already been registered.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 'Janata Curfew' back in Goa, three-day lockdown from today
details.content:
• The streets of Goa wore a deserted look after 8 pm on Thursday as the state observed 'Janata Curfew' to curb the spread of coronavirus
  • The state government has announced Janata Curfew between 8 pm to 6 am till August 10
  • Besides, lockdown will be in force on July 17, 18 and 19
  • During the Janata Curfew, movement for all non- essential activities has been prohibited
  • Ahead of lockdown, people thronged markets across the state to stock essentials

(Inputs from PTI)

Rajasthan Government issues directions to all district & police authorities in the State for 'strict compliance of common prescriptions regarding social distancing and regulation of inter-state movement of persons'. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/JxX83zwgbc

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: Cases in India cross 10-lakh mark, death toll over 25,000
details.content:
India's COVID-19 count on Thursday crossed two grim milestones of 10 lakh cases and 25,000 deaths, according to official data from states, even as the Centre said active cases now constituted one-third of the total infections. The total coronavirus caseload stood at 10,00,202 while there were 25,553 deaths from the disease, according to a tally at 9.30 pm based on reports from states and union territories.India is ranked third in the global COVID-19 tally after the US and Brazil. (Inputs frpm PTI)

(File Photo | EPS)

details.title: News from Bengaluru
details.content:
Bengaluru:Karnataka Medical Education Min K Sudhakar held a meeting through video conference with private/govt establishments involved in testing&treatment of COVID-19 in State, y'day.

Total 51,422 cases including 19,729 recoveries&1032 deaths were reported in State till y'day. pic.twitter.com/ElZT36g4qU

details.title: Services resume at Kullu Manali Airport
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh: Services resumed at Kullu Manali Airport in Bhuntar. Airport Director Neeraj Kumar Srivastava said, "A flight carrying 12 passengers from Delhi arrived here and 2 passengers departed for Delhi" (16.07.2020) pic.twitter.com/YkhUSVxdjY

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: Court complex in Patna restricts entry of visitors
details.content:
Bihar: Few authorized persons were allowed to enter Patna Court complex as the entry of other persons including staff members has been restricted in view of lockdown imposed in the State from 16th to 23rd July. (16.07.2020) pic.twitter.com/qtGgsxZZan

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: Lucknow college develops currency disinfection device
details.content:
Lucknow:Anuj Sharma&his team at APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University claim they've developed currency note disinfection cum counting machine.He says,"It costed Rs 14-15 thousand to build prototype, can be slightly higher for commercial production as we'll ensure quality." (16.07) pic.twitter.com/6JyX63b7xh

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) July 16, 2020

details.title: Social distancing again goes for a toss
details.content:
Thiruvananthapuram: Social distancing norms were violated as students and their parents gathered outside a Kerala Engineering Architecture Medical (KEAM) examination centre in Pattom. (16.07.2020) pic.twitter.com/fxh38q34xU

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: Latest Assam numbers
details.content: 892 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Assam on July 16. Total cases stand at 20,646 including 13,554 recovered, 7,039 active cases and 50 deaths: State Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: Update from Rajasthan
details.content:
Rajasthan Government issues directions to all district & police authorities in the State for 'strict compliance of common prescriptions regarding social distancing and regulation of inter-state movement of persons'. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/JxX83zwgbc

— ANI (@ANI) July 16, 2020

details.title: News from Haryana
details.content: Haryana Government allows state government employees with physical disabilities of 50% or above and also those who are totally vision impaired to work from home.

details.title: 207 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: 207 new COVID19 positive cases and four deaths reported in Jharkhand on July 16. The total number of positive cases in the state is now 4783, death toll 42.

details.title: ICMR writes to states, UTs again
details.content: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) writes to all states and UTs to apply to obtain district-wise login credentials for data entry of testing data into ICMR portal.

details.title: 34,956 cases, 687 deaths: India registers its highest daily tally
details.content: COVID-19 cases cross the 10 lakh mark in India with the highest single-day spike of 34,956 cases, and 687 deaths. Total positive cases stand at 10,03,832 including 3,42,473 active cases, 6,35,757 cured/discharged/migrated and 25,602 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

details.title: Lockdown scenes from Goa
details.content:
Goa: Streets in Panaji wear a deserted look as the state observes lockdown in view of rising cases of COVID-19.

The state government has announced 'Janata Curfew' between 8 pm and 6 am till August 10 and complete lockdown for three days on Friday, Saturday and Sunday this week. pic.twitter.com/P4HdKBH0Ml

— ANI (@ANI) July 17, 2020

details.title: Close to 3.35 lakh samples tested in last 24 hours
details.content: 1,30,72,718 samples tested for COVID-19 till 16th July, of these 3,33,228 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research.

details.title: BBMP bats for lockdown extension in Bengaluru
details.content: It will be better if we get more time to tackle COVID-19 cases, we wish for the extension of lockdown for one more week. We have given the proposal to government: M Goutham Kumar, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagar Palike (BBMP) Mayor.

details.title: Human trials of COVAXIN of Bharat Biotech started today
details.content:
Human trial with Corona vaccine (COVAXIN) of Bharat Biotech started at PGI Rohtak today. Three subjects were enrolled today. All have tolerated the vaccine very well. There were no adverse efforts: Anil Vij, Haryana Health Minister #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/uqQSpjKd4K

— ANI (@ANI) July 17, 2020

details.title: Odisha: Spouse/next of kin of ASHA, Anganwadi workers who succumb to virus in line of duty to receive monthy payment
details.content:
Spouse/next of kin of deceased ASHA workers, who succumbs to COVID-19 in line of duty under active deployment, shall continue to receive Rs 5,000 per month till the date they would have attained the age of 60 years had they survived: Odisha Government

— ANI (@ANI) July 17, 2020

details.title: COVID-19: To overcome shortage of doctors, Telangana govt to deploy 1200 PG medical students
details.content: In a major decision to overcome the shortage of doctors amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the Telangana government has decided to absorb 1,200 PG medical students in the state in government hospitals. Besides, the state government on Friday decided to fill 200 doctors' vacancies in primary health centres (PHCs). All the medical and health staff would continue get 10 per cent extra salary as a COVID incentive. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19: Vijayapura becomes tenth district in Karnataka to cross 1,000 cases
details.content:
With the addition of 44 COVID-19 cases on Thursday, Vijayapura became the 10th district in Karnataka with a tally of more than 1,000. As per official records, 719 COVID-19 patients have been discharged, while over 400 are active and 19 have died in the district so far.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVAXIN enters phase 1 clinical trials
details.content:
Meanwhile #India’s first Indigenous #Covid19 Vaccine #COVAXIN entered phase-1 clinical trials across the country two days back. This is a randomised, double-blind, placebo- controlled clinical trial in 375 volunteers in India @NewIndianXpress #COVID19India

details.title: India made fight against COVID-19 a people's movement: PM Modi at virtual UN Ecosoc address
details.content:
The Prime Minister in his addresss lauded India's effort in fighting COVID-19 and said "Our motto is ‘Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikaas, Sabka Vishwas’ – meaning ‘Together, for everyone’s growth, with everyone’s trust’. This resonates with the core SDG principle of leaving no one behind.."
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Recovered Maharashtra minister to donate his plasma
details.content:
Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad, who has recovered from COVID-19 infection around two months back, on Friday said that he has decided to donate his plasma, used for treating patients.

details.title: One-day spike of 8,308 COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra; 258 more dead
details.content:
With the single-day spike of 8,308 new COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, the tally of patients in the state mounted to 2,92,589 on Friday, the health department said. This is the third time that the number of single-day cases has breached the 8,000-mark in the state.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, who was in home quarantine, admitted to Hospital
details.content: Actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan was admitted at Nanavati Hospital on Friday. Earlier, she was home quarantined after she tested positive for COVID-19. (File Photo)

details.title: Man booked for sexual assault on woman in COVID-19 quarantine centre in Mumbai
details.content:
A 40-year-old woman was sexually assaulted at a quarantine centre in Panvel in neighbouring Navi Mumbai by another inmate, a senior police official said on Friday. The incident came to light on Thursday evening after the woman lodged a complaint with Panvel Rural police station, he added.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Senior priest in Tirupati 'suffering' from COVID-19 to be shifted to Chennai
details.content: The priest,who was also suffering from severe diabetes and high BP, would be shifted from Tirupati COVID care facility to Chennai tonight or tomorrow. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 testing camp to be organised at JNU
details.content:
• A COVID-19 testing camp will be organised at the Jawaharlal Nehru University for three days starting on Saturday by the district administration, the varsity said.
  • JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar urged the varsity community to wear a mask, follow social distancing norms and wash hands frequently
  • The camp is being organised with the help of the District Magistrate, South District and will be held on July 18, 19 and 20
  • The first case of coronavirus was detected in JNU when a pharmacist at the university's health centre had tested positive last month

(Inputs frpm PTI)
